sentences: Olen harjunud õhtuti nooremate laste eest hoolitsema.
Elu läks oma igapäevast harjunud rada.
context: The word 'harjunud' is the past participle of the Estonian verb 'harjuma', meaning 'to get used to', 'to become accustomed to', or 'to adapt to'. It describes a state where someone has become familiar through repeated experience. The word can be used with different grammatical cases - in this form it's likely part of the illative case (motion into) or comitative case (with). When describing people, it indicates they have adapted to certain conditions, activities, or situations through prior experience.
